reviews.review: There's that game, some better games, some other even better games, then there's Portal and then there's Jesus. Just like Yahtzee's said.

A landmark game.  One of the best ever.   First-person (dark) comedy logic puzzle game, with occasional minor timed/action sequences.  They teach you a new puzzle concept at your own pace, then later you might do it again under some time pressure.  Quick-saves make it relatively painless.

If you don't own it yet, you absolutely must try the demo.
Excelente juego. Esperando la 2da parte.

WARNING: THIS GAME MADE MY HEAD EXPLODE

Completely original idea and a totally innovative use of the source engine, these are the kinds of games that  totally renew my confidence in Valve.  Its a clever game that makes the player think "Wow , I'm so smart for having figured that out, I bet no-one else did it like that." when there's only one way to beat each level.

If you've ever seen the movie "Cube" that's what I felt like playing this game.

Absolutley brilliant!
One of my Favorite games ever. It really gets you to think to solve it's amazing puzzles and GLaDOS is hilariouse. So worth playing all the way thru to the end.

Welcome to Aperture Science, the direct concurrent to Black Mesa.
During this test, the only way to survive is *buggy* toooo... aoskdadz *normal* use the given Handheld Portal Device through the test chambers. If you manage not to drow in *buggy* azffmlffdgddd *normal* toxic substance, not to meet a perfectly harmless turret, not to get squished by a dynamic door device, you will be rewarded with a tasty cake...

Come on, Chell.
An instant classic everyone should own. Appropriate for all ages too, with great dark sense of humour.
ひとつの物語としてプレイできる作品。パズルのような謎解き要素に、FPSの要素をくっつけたような作品。Valveのユーモアさと考えさせられるストーリーは必見。はじめてのFPSにもオススメです。エンディングの「Still Alive」は神。

Un clásico instantaneo, no solo es un buen juego de puzzle, sino que te exije ser un buen jugador de FPS. Único en su género, una verdadera pieza de arte, y la máxima recomendación de Ramus y de un servidor como juego de PC.

Blue portals

Portal prelude 
Portal dajavu 

And many more.

9/10

This was a triumph. I'm making a note here, "huge sucess"!... Truer words were never spoken. Portal manages to captivate with its brilliant mechanics and awesome character design. GLaDOS is one of the most entertaining villians of all time, and the setting is just as interesting. Antiseptic walls and atmosphere seem like the order of the day, until you get glimpses behind the curtain. Where those whitewashed walls give way to decay and scribbles from other test subjects. There is quite a lot of storyline here for those that wish to dig deeper, but the general gameplay will keep you playing through even after you finish the game. Portal will make you feel genuinely clever, and your I.Q. may just raise a few point if you finish all the challenge maps. This is one of those rare games that belong in a museum for being groundbreaking and ingenuitive. If you haven't played it then I pity you. 10/10
Impossible to recommend highly enough.
Best single player puzzle game on the planet!
This game is a challenge. Its accurate and a huge puzzle. Its a bit of a riddle here and there with the GLaDOS lines and challenges, but this game isnt bad.. :D
Great start for the series, a must have for everyone.

Portal hat unsere Erde beeinflusst.  Es gibt so viele Details in diesem Spiel auf die man immer wieder im Lebenstoßen kann. Portal ist die Basis für einiges. Dieses Spiel muss jeder gespielt haben. Es macht wirklich spaß und erfordert durch seine Schwierigkeit einiges an logischem Denkvermögen. Spiel dieses Spiel. Du wirst es nicht bereuen. Danach gehörtst du zu uns.

"Why yes, Memington, I am lonely..."
Well, maybe I can get my friends to hang out with you.
"Oh, that's okay. I'm sure you'd rather kill them yourself."
...
Pure awesomeness! Fun, mind-bending puzzles and humour abound!
Great puzzle gameplay, with a sprinkling of plot here and there to tie it into the Half-Life universe. Get it as part of The Orange Box.

If you're on steam and you still haven't played this, then there is something wrong with you. I'm not being figurative, there is literally something wrong with you. It might be because you're some sort of indie douchebag who thinks that because something is this popular that it has to be overhyped, or something. To which I say: Shut up, Portal is deserving of every single ounce of overhype and outplayed memes it gets and has spawned, and in fact deserves more. It's a absolutely innovative puzzle FPS, the tone the story takes is the best I've come across... seriously, why are you still reading this? Go get it and play it or you're off my friends list.

Yaaaaaay, Portal! What do you get when Valve decides to make a puzzle-shooter? One of the most creepy games ever made. Sense, it makes none.

Edit: Portal is close to 10 years old, and while the graphics are somewhat dated, this gem is still one of the most playable, and replayable games ever made. Not playing Portal at least once is missing out. Which is why I nominated it for the "Test of Time" award.
Very impressive game. A mix of humor, excellent physics, and just the overall mystique of the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device makes for a fabulous expericnce. 9.5/10. Too bad it's so short!

One of my greatest gaming experiences of all time. I don't want to spoil any plot, but there is much more plot than I originally thought. As for the puzzle solving stuff... one of, if not, the best puzzle games ever. So many puzzles I solved in ways that didn't seem intended by the developers. There are plenty of ways to approach most of the later ones, speaking of... they can get challenging. User created maps are also great. GET THIS GAME! PLEASE!
Great game!!!
Valve redefined video games once again with Portal. Just stop whatever you're doing and go play it. Now!

You know all those 'the cake is a lie' comments you heard for about a year? Yea, this is where they come from. You will play it for that reason.

Not to mention amazing gameplay, amusing dialogue, innovative puzzles, thought provoking situations, dark comedy, and the deep heartfelt romance with the companion cube.
One of the best games in the world!

This is an awesome game if you like 3D puzzle FPS game with physics, portals, and humor.  Very well made and feels logical.  The game is only 3-4 hours, but it makes you feel smart and a very enjoyable play.

Portal is that rare thing in video games: a novelty. It's a puzzle-solving game where you depend upon your grey matter rather than your reflexes... but it still manages to be incredibly macarbe.

As the storyline evolves, unintrusively, you learn that you are the plaything of GLaDOS, a supercomputer in control of a vast underground facility where you are put through a series to 'tests'. GLaDOS is senile, merciless and highly amusing. Tests concern a human's ability to use a "portal gun" that projects a pair of inter-connected 'holes' that make for some bizarre physics and visuals. Solving puzzles generally involves choosing where and when to place the portals, in order to deal with obstacles or threats.

While there is no cake, there are also no hitpoints, and no roving monsters. It makes for a very relaxing game. A 'quiet night in', instead of dispatching hordes of zombies with your mates.

Be warned: Portal is not a long game, and has limited replay value - but it is satisfying!
Dem portals
A challenging and fun puzzler with a good story.

One of the most innovative takes on the first person perspective that I've ever seen, you don't have bullets, you don't have swarms of enemies trying to rip your face off... However, what you do have is an experimental transpositional portal technology emitter gun. 
 The story is dramatic in a very subtle, dark way; haunted by the disembodied voice of GlaDos, the AI in control of the world around you, at first serene and composed, your personal narrator quickly devolves into the depths of neurosis... and takes you along for the ride.

[h1]PORTAL[/h1]
[b]Originally based on Narbacular Drop by a team at DigiPen, Valve hired the team to create what is now known as Portal. 

Portal™ is a new single player game from Valve. Set in the mysterious Aperture Science Laboratories, Portal has been called one of the most innovative new games on the horizon and will offer gamers hours of unique gameplay.

The game is designed to change the way players approach, manipulate, and surmise the possibilities in a given environment; similar to how Half-Life® 2's Gravity Gun innovated new ways to leverage an object in any given situation.

Players must solve physical puzzles and challenges by opening portals to maneuvering objects, and themselves, through space.

You play as Silent protagonist Chell. Set place in Aperture Science, a top secret science facility competing with Black Mesa. You must test, solve and traverse puzzles to escape and most importantly survive against GlaDOS.

I highly recommend Portal for its innovation and famous stature. It's a very fun unique puzzle game and is very worth the Playthrough. It's quite short but hits the spot just right. 

The Cake is a Lie.[/b]
It's short, but great quality, really fun(ny), and made out of awesomeness.
The Cake Is a Lie!
This is my favorite FPS.  No blood but your own, and your enemies are on the most part polite.  The only downside is that the cake is a lie.
ПРОЕКТ ЗАМЕЧАТЕЛНЫЙ 10 балов
Indeed, you are NOW thinking with Portals.
Actaully cake is not a lie in Garry's Mod you can spawn it :D
Игра просто The Best!!
Simple, elegent game that tells its story subtly and without long dialogue sequences. Despite coming out in 2007, the game has yet to show its age.

On first note, Portal is immediately defined as not a game for everyone; its distinct blend of dark humor and seemingly whitewashed visuals are not for the palate of the modern FPS gamer. However, if you stick with it long enough (and you should: it's only about 2-3 hours) you may find that it grows on you very quickly. Though not as adrenaline-charged as most FPS titles, the gameplay is nonetheless still silky smooth. What stands out the most, though, is Portal's ability to make isolation seem as amazing as being in the middle of a firefight.

There are no guns, no (live) enemies, and all you have to help you survive are your wits and your Handheld Portal Device. Constantly opposed by GLaDOS (who has some of the most amazing lines possibly conceived), this is the game for the quick thinker, the brooder, the one who wants some thought and care put into a story.

Pick it up, and enjoy.
BEST. GAME. EVER.

Portal is a great first person puzzel game. With your portal cannon you have to figure out how to get to the exit and to the next level. Find secrets and be aware that the cacke at the end is just fake ;)

THE BEST game of 2007 still shakes the first-person genre today. 2011 will be portal 2. Only Valve could have redesigned a FPS to not only fun with loads of charecter but great challenges. This is another Sourse engine based game that delivers tranquility to a personal story of your charecter. 
Valve doesnt just have great minds behind making their games they have the best and i would say the orange box would be the best game box set in the world to grab a hold of.

Depois de anos de muita repetitividade, era hora de uma onda de jogos inovadores pintarem na minha frente pra jogar. Portal apareceu de graça. Fiquei entusiasmado com o jogo ao ver um trailer e deixei baixando os 5,5 GB do jogo à noite. No dia seguinte, resolvi ver qual era. O jogo realmente é excelente. A mecânica dele me empolgou bastante, os gráficos são muito bons mesmo com o jogo já tendo lá seus 3 anos. Mas a minha maior surpresa acabou sendo negativa. Quando eu menos esperava, após apenas umas 3 horas de jogatina, o jogo acaba! Quando começava a ficar melhor. Foram 3h muito divertidas, excelentes, soberbas, mas foram os 5,5 GB mais curtos da minha vida. Fiquei com uma sensação de alívio de ter baixado gratuitamente o jogo, pois não sei se valeria a pena pagar por um jogo tão curto. Todavia, ficou um imenso "quero mais" no ar, uma esperança de que seja lançada uma sequência full-length continuando do ponto onde esse acaba. Aí sim, valeria muito a pena. E criatividade ainda pode vir de empresas grandes como a Valve. Bom saber.

NOTA: 9/10
